page.title: 08FARMING AT LANDRAKE
page.content: Pound Farm in Landrake is a two hundred acre farm split by the A38 trunk road.It is worked by the owner (Mr.Norman Brewer),his son and one farm labourer. The farm livestock consists of cows, calves and sheep.There are 40 South Devon cows and about 150 calves.These calves are known as sucklers,using the cows for milk although many of the calves are a cross breed between a Freisan cow and a Hereford bull.The calves are reared for beef.Some cows have one calf to feed,others four. A dealer purchases the calves from markets in the area.They are cross breeds because there is a shortage of South Devon calves for sale. There are 120 sheep,reared for their meat but the wool is sold as a bi-product
